job.title: Software Developer - Web Applications II
job.industry: Information Technology and Services,Computer Software,Financial Services
job.description:
Responsibilities     - Design, develop and maintain the UX for various applications   
  - Ensure responsive implementation   
  - Apply client-side design approaches that enables applications to be scalable on the dimensions of data and users   
  - Design client-side solutions using established brand and design guidelines to ensure UX consistency   
  - Ensure client-side product quality by doing comprehensive UI testing with automation   
  - Define the WEB APIs necessary to support the UX   
  - Source ideas from the open source community to help keep the product suite current   
  - Ensure that client-side applications adhere to security standards and guidelines   
  - Ensure that client-side applications adhere to coding standards   
  - Collaborate with fellow developers, designers and analysts to solve problems         
Experience      The ideal candidate would possess the following:     - Minimum 5 years of industry experience working with complex web tiers in JavaScript, HTML, CSS, SVG   
  - Extensive experience using TypeScript with Angular 11+ and Bootstrap    
  - Experience applying design patterns to develop and support web pages that run on multiple browsers including mobile/handheld devices   
  - Experience building high-traffic, scalable, and high-performance Web sites   
  - Experience developing solutions using an Agile approach, like Scrum   
  - Experience apply security technologies such as TLS, SAML and OAuth2 and OpenID         
Skills And Qualifications      The ideal candidate would have some experience or familiarity with the following front-end technologies:     - Excellent Web development skills using JavaScript, HTML, HTML5, CSS, CSS3, .less   
  - Strong knowledge of TypeScript with Angular    
  - Responsive UI design and development using Bootstrap   
  - Knowledge of RESTful services and Web API's   
  - Build tooling: Grunt, Bower, NPM   
  - Testing: mocha, karma   
  - Familiarity with API frameworks such as Swagger or RAML      
Powered by JazzHR      6PaMW6WOuV
